status.info: We are still developing and optimizing this protocol

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dm9kj","text":"Prepare the primer pools 1, 2, and 3 by reconstituting lyophilized primers to a concentration of 100µM using nuclease-free water","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aurec","text":"The tables below show the volume of each 100µM forward and reverse primers stock to be added in the respective pools. The total volume provided in the table is 100µL with a concentration of 5µM for each pool. However, it is recommended to make larger volume pool then split into aliquots.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7dkq6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"40vdh","text":" (µL)"],"colWidths":[100,100,"216"],"data":[["DBP","4300","5"],["MSP9","4333","5"],["MSP1_1","4338","5"],["RBP1a_1","4318","5"],["RBP2a_1","4314","5"],["RBP2b_1","4357","5"],["RON2_1","4350","5"],["Water","--","30"],["Total","--","100"]],"guid":"F88567958B754AE794615A6F5C5FD45C","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4pclp","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":{},"printData":[["DBP","4300","5"],["MSP9","4333","5"],["MSP1_1","4338","5"],["RBP1a_1","4318","5"],["RBP2a_1","4314","5"],["RBP2b_1","4357","5"],["RON2_1","4350","5"],["Water","--","30"],["Total","--","100"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23]}},"3":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fabp8","text":"Genes like msp1, rbp1a, rbp2a, rbp2b, and ron2 have sequence lengths from 5kb to 8kb bps. These longer fragment genes were each split into two segments in order to standardize the size to be similar with DBP (~3.7kb) and MSP9 (~2.6kb). The split genes are now referred to as \"gene name_1\" for first gene segment and \"gene name_2\" for the second gene segment.  Extra base pairs flanking the target region were added to reach ~4300 bp in total length. Primers were designed within these flanking regions.","type":"unstyled"}],"collapsed":false,"entityMap":{}}},"4":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"A_2":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"A_3":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"A_4":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"A_5":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"A_6":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"A_7":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_2":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_3":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_4":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_5":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_6":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_7":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"C_1":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"C_2":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"C_3":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"C_4":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"C_5":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"C_6":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"C_7":{"className":"_dt-h-center"}},"colTitles":["Pool 3 genes","Size (bp)","Volume for each primer (µL)"],"colWidths":[100,100,"219"],"data":[["MSP1_2","4381","5"],["RBP1a_2","4387","5"],["RBP2a_2","4326","5"],["RBP2b_2","4303","5"],["RON_2","4310","5"],["Water","--","50"],["Total","--","100"]],"guid":"3DEF1DD36CB54D46BAC088275A93EA83","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fqtre","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":{},"printData":[["MSP1_2","4381","5"],["RBP1a_2","4387","5"],["RBP2a_2","4326","5"],["RBP2b_2","4303","5"],["RON_2","4310","5"],["Water","--","50"],["Total","--","100"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23,23]}},"5":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"frqh8","text":"Initially, Pools 2 and 3 were grouped together, however during our preliminary experiments, we did not observe any amplified products in these genes. We believe that the issue may be due to the overlap between the forward primer of the second gene segment and the reverse primer of the first gene segment, potentially causing interference during PCR amplification. As a result, we made a decision to separate the second gene segment into a different pool.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"18ldi","text":"Combine PCR components as follows. The reaction is for 1x sample. Volume and concentration are the same for all three pools.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ago8r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"59fg8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6kk9o","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1idsf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2dr5q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_5":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_5":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["PCR components","1x volume (µL)"],"colWidths":["260",100],"data":[["2x KAPA HotStart HiFi RM","6.25"],["0.5µM primer pool (s)","1.5"],["Nuclease-free water","3.75"],["Template DNA (1-100ng)","1"],["Total","12.5"]],"guid":"A27F703835EA434B94DA2D9FD1A2AD49","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f61c4","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":{},"printData":[["2x KAPA HotStart HiFi RM","6.25"],["0.5µM primer pool (s)","1.5"],["Nuclease-free water","3.75"],["Template DNA (1-100ng)","1"],["Total","12.5"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

PCR conditions for pools 2 and 3 PCR conditions have been adjusted to accommodate the  longer gene sequences in these pools hence, the longer extension times.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"3":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f7nde","text":"Safe stopping point. Products can now be stored at -20 or -4C","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c57j7","text":"Run 2-3 µL of the amplified product on a 1% agarose gel. Strong bands in the expected sizes indicate that the target genes have been amplified in the samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b7faa","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9m5da","text":"Transfer 5µL from each of the amplified pools into a new tube, then continue with the bead clean-up process.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cr4ft","text":"Resuspend AMPure beads by vortexing. Then, add one volume of AMPure beads to the combined PCR product; mix by gentle flicking.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9njod","text":"Incubate for 5 mins at room temperature, either on rotator, or gently flick every ~1 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"86mii","text":"Spin down the sample and pellet on a magnet until the eluate is clear and colourless","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bgu3","text":"Leaving the tube on the magnet, carefully pipette off and discard the supernatant","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"41brn","text":"Keep the tube on magnet, and wash beads with 200 µl of freshly prepared 75% ethanol (without disturbing the pellet; leave ~15 secs). Remove the 75% ethanol using a pipette and discard.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fclcv","text":"Repeat ethanol wash (step 10)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1d7qk","text":"After the second ethanol wash, spin down the sample briefly then put the sample back on the magnet. Pipette off residual wash. Allow to dry (~1-2 min)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"afm2s","text":"Remove the tube from the magnetic rack and resuspend pellet in 13 µl nuclease-free water by gentle flicking. Incubate for 5-10 minutes at 37 °C (heat block).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"c9dqj","text":"Pellet beads on magnet until the eluate is clear and colourless.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4udpk","text":"Transfer eluate to fresh DNA LoBind tube. Retain 1 µl of DNA for quantification (yield should be \u003e10ng/µL).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"eqih5","text":"You can now discard the tube with beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7o9go","text":"Combine PCR components as follows. The reaction is for 1x sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7u7to","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"64nou","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dtcjl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"afp4u","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fukbc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"A_2":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"A_3":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"A_4":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"A_5":{"className":"_dt-bold _dt-h-center"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_2":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_3":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_4":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_5":{"className":"_dt-bold _dt-h-center"}},"colTitles":["PCR components","1x volume (µl)"],"colWidths":["200",100],"data":[["LongAmp mastermix","12.5"],["PCR Barcode (Nanopore)","1"],["Purified DNA","5-10"],["Nuclease-free water","1.5-6.5"],["Total","25"]],"guid":"5D938C173D76493AADF6FA5B7563EE3B","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["LongAmp mastermix","12.5"],["PCR Barcode (Nanopore)","1"],["Purified DNA","5-10"],["Nuclease-free water","1.5-6.5"],["Total","25"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23]}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"37egh","text":"Volume of nuclease-free water is adjusted according to the volume of DNA template added. DNA concentration should be 50ng to 90ng in total.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cctue","text":"Incubate the reaction into a thermal cycler following the conditions {"blocks":[{"key":"2t187","text":"Bead clean up. Refer to Bead clean up step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"averl","text":"Ensure that the concentration of each sample is equal when pooling multiple samples, targeting a total of 70-80 ng per sample. Calculate the necessary volume for each sample individually and then pool them together.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8iiab","text":"Total volume of pooled sample will be \u003e100 µl, depending on the number of samples and volume added. Proceed to final bead clean-up before library sequencing preparation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3s431","text":"Refer to Bead clean up step. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dag0t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"35jv7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5vpa9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"13em6","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9etjo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dj93s","text":"Instead of adding one volume of AMPure beads into the tube, include beads at a 0.4x ratio. This will ensure that shorter gene sequences (~\u003e1kb) will be removed.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6rqjm","text":"Add 50 µl nuclease free-water instead of 13 µl for reconstituting the pellet. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"aaeqr","text":"Sample is now ready for library preparation and sequencing","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
